comments.content: Confirm A / D after a lot of headaches! D is tricky actually in fact it mentions status reason = revised. When you revise a quote the system closes the current one into a state Closed with Reason "Revised" and create a new version in state Draft. Now, the draft quote must be deleted and then you can close the opportunity as won, since you will have just one opportunity with status "closed" and "reason" revised. It's a nightmare ....

discussion.content: A & D are the correct answer

Selected Answer: AD
Opportunities can not be closed with Draft and Active Quotes
*********There are still active or draft quotes associated with this opportunity. These must be closed before the opportunity can be closed.********

Selected Answer: AD
Correct Answer:
A & D
Identical to a recent previous question just worded differently. Really strange that this one did not have original correct answers

discussion.content: But if the quote is in revised state it means that the quote is in a draft state and If i'm not wrong is not possible to close on opp if its quote is in draft state

comments.content: If create the Opportunity with different status of Quote and click Won button system shows a message: “You can't close the opportunity as close won if there are active or draft quotes are associated with it. There are still active or draft quotes associated with this opportunity. These must be closed before the opportunity can be closed.” When Order created from Quote, Quote has Won status, if close Quote with Reason status Revise and select No to not create revise quote, Quote has Closed status

discussion.content: Answers are A&D. If you try and close the quote using "Closed quote" from the command bar, it will have a status reason of "Revised" by default on next dialog box. Once you close it, you should be able to close the opportunity as close won. You can't close the opportunity as close won if there are active or draft quotes are associated with it.

comments.content:
Did you check it practically?? Please do the following - 
1. Create Opportunity 
2. Create multiple quotes and Activate them.
3. Create Order from one of the Quote (What you said in your second point is only applicable for single Active quote). Please read the question carefully.
And the result is Opportunity stays Open. Note you only get close related Opportunity option in dialog when you have one quote but not multiple.

Please test practically before adding comments. Microsoft has already created mess by creating weird questions.

discussion.content:
The answer should be only C.
Reason: The order can be created if the status of the Quotes is active. The below 3 steps are part of Create Order from Quote.

✑ Create an order from a quote.
✑ Close the associated opportunity as won.
✑ Update the actual values to reflect values from the quote.

choices.B: The opportunity has other quotes in the draft status.
choices.C: The opportunity has other quotes in the active status.
choices.A: The opportunity has other quotes in the won status.
choices.D: The opportunity has other quotes in the revised status reason.

questions.question_text:
An order uses quote and order functionality in Dynamics 365 for Sales. Multiple quotes may be provided to customers at one time. Quotes are revised often.
You need to create a process that meets the following requirements:
✑ Create an order from a quote.
✑ Close the associated opportunity as won.
✑ Update the actual values to reflect values from the quote.
Which two opportunities can you close as won? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

A company uses Dynamics 365 for Sales.
You must track a competitor to help your company win a sale.
You need to associate the competitor with a Dynamics 365 entity.
To which type of entity can you associate the competitor?

discussion.content: Since opportunity is a potential sale and lead it can be treated as a potential customer, then the correct answer is Opportunity.

comments.content: You are not likely to have "Competitor" value available at Lead stage, just like you generally don't have "Value" of deal and "estimated closure time". Thats why there is a qualification of lead to Opportunity, which is a more mature version of Lead
Sales are not won at lead level :-). Lead is a potential sale i.e. may or may not be converted into actual sale. So the answer is Opportunity.

discussion.content: It can be Lead as well !!
In exam. Opportunity is correct answer

Correct answer.
- Qualify is for leads, not for opportunities
- actual revenue is required field on (default) opportunity close

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are a salesperson working with Dynamics 365. Your role includes working with opportunities.
You need to close opportunities.
Which actions should you perform? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

D is correct

Selected Answer: D
The customer is just requesting another quote, doesn't mean that the first quote needs to be closed, what if he decides to go with it? Correct answer for me is D

Selected Answer: A
A. because why would you keep the first quote open at all, when new ones are going to be created.

comments.content:
A is the correct answer - 
Good one ceejaybee - Because if you keep all those quotes "open" is going to be hard to close the relevant opportunity. Hope this makes sense.
Coz there may be instances where the customer wants to see the prices of the original opportunity as well. That doesn't mean that the 1st quote is ignored or cancelled.

For me it's D. It doesn't say you need to close anything first. And to add more quotes, we just need to go to the subgrid and add a new quote.
questions says - The customer requests another quote that includes the original details from the opportunity. This can be achieved only by creating a new quote. given answer A is correct

comments.content: then why would you close the first? you need to create multiple qoutes
If you have modified your products in the quote and then revise it, you will have the same modified products with a Quote in draft status. I think A is correct
It didn't ask to modify the first, it just ask to create another one

questions.question_text:
A salesperson sends an active quote to a customer. The customer requests another quote that includes the original details from the opportunity.
You need to create multiple quotes.
What should you do?

choices.D: Create a new quote from the original opportunity.
choices.B: Create a revision to the active quote.
choices.A: Close the quote and then create a quote from the opportunity.

choices.B: Add the competitor to the opportunity close record.
choices.C: Create a user post for the competitor.
choices.A: Select the Follow option for the competitor.
choices.D: Enable auditing for the competitor entity.

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales.
You need to associate a competitor with each closed opportunity for reporting.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Add the competitor to the opportunity close record.

Select the competitor when you close the opportunity
